law.catch_line: Legislative findings and intent regarding reading.

text.section: The General Assembly hereby finds that reading proficiency is a gateway skill necessary for all of Kentucky students to achieve the academic goals established in KRS 158.6451. It is Kentucky's goal that all children learn to read well before exiting the primary program and that all middle and high school students have the skills necessary to read complex materials in specific core subjects and comprehend and constructively apply the information.

law.history: Amended 2010 Ky. Acts ch. 42, sec. 1, effective July 15, 2010. -- Created 2005 Ky. Acts ch. 127, sec. 2, effective March 18, 2005.

metadata.lrc-note: (3/18/2005). 2005 Ky. Acts ch. 127, which created this section, KRS 158.791, provides that the Act shall be cited as the "Read to Achieve Act of 2005."
